dt: {bc}a brief written summary of a document {bc}{sx|abstract||}
{bc}a formal abridged record of the proceedings in a legal action
{bc}a list of legal causes to be tried
{bc}the caseload of a court or judge
{bc}a calendar of business matters to be acted on {bc}{sx|agenda||}
{bc}an identifying statement about a document placed on its outer surface or cover

a formal abridged record of the proceedings in a legal action

dt: {bc}to place on the docket for legal action
{bc}to make a brief abstract of (something, such as a legal matter) and inscribe it in a list
{bc}to inscribe (something, such as a document) with an identifying statement

shortdef: to place on the docket for legal action
to make a brief abstract of (something, such as a legal matter) and inscribe it in a list
to inscribe (something, such as a document) with an identifying statement

dt: {bc}on a list of legal cases to be heard by a court

dt.t: The judge had to postpone some of the cases {it}on the docket{/it}.

dt: {bc}on a list of things to be considered (by a group of people, such as a committee)

dt.t: The new library will be the first item {it}on the{/it} committee's {it}docket{/it}.

on a list of things to be considered (by a group of people, such as a committee)
